title: Modern Love, review: it's hard to care about the problems of these beautiful, unrealistically wealthy people
text:
“Happy endings,” wrote Margaret Atwood, “are best achieved by keeping the right doors locked.”

In Amazon’s starry new series of eight half-hour stories the doors are firmly bolted against the poor, the unattractive and the uneducated. The show is inspired by true stories lifted from the weekly New York Times column, to which readers have been submitting compelling personal essays for 15 years now, exploring love in all its weird, magical, mundane, surprising and terrifying variations.

Alas, John Carney’s series mutes the rich diversity of those experiences to one, long, neutral-toned lifestyle advertisement designed to flatter the paper’s readers and Amazon Prime’s viewers. So we watch a procession...
